

## Descripción

*Class, take your seats! It's PRIME-time for a quiz... `nc jupiter.challenges.picoctf.org 1981`*
## Pistas

*[RSA info](https://simple.wikipedia.org/wiki/RSA_algorithm)*
## Solución


```

┌──(kali㉿kali)-[~]
└─$ nc jupiter.challenges.picoctf.org 1981 

Good morning class! It's me Ms. Adleman-Shamir-Rivest
Today we will be taking a pop quiz, so I hope you studied. Cramming just will not do!
You will need to tell me if each example is possible, given your extensive crypto knowledge.
Inputs and outputs are in decimal. No hex here!
#### NEW PROBLEM ####
q : 60413
p : 76753
##### PRODUCE THE FOLLOWING ####
n
IS THIS POSSIBLE and FEASIBLE? (Y/N):Y
#### TIME TO SHOW ME WHAT YOU GOT! ###
n: 4636878989
Outstanding move!!!


#### NEW PROBLEM ####
p : 54269
n : 5051846941
##### PRODUCE THE FOLLOWING ####
q
IS THIS POSSIBLE and FEASIBLE? (Y/N):Y
#### TIME TO SHOW ME WHAT YOU GOT! ###
q: 93089
Outstanding move!!!

n :

q
p
IS THIS POSSIBLE and FEASIBLE? (Y/N):N

Operacion 1:
┌──(kali㉿kali)-[~]
└─$ python3
Python 3.12.7 (main, Nov  8 2024, 17:55:36) [GCC 14.2.0] on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> q=60413
>>> p=76753
>>> n= p * q
>>> n
4636878989


Operacion 2:
┌──(kali㉿kali)-[~]
└─$ python3
Python 3.12.7 (main, Nov  8 2024, 17:55:36) [GCC 14.2.0] on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> n=5051846941
>>> p =54269
>>> q = n/p
>>> q
93089.0
>>> 

Operacion 3: No hay, no se puede sacar p y q teniendo n y e, ya que seria necesario factorizar.

Operacion 4: 
┌──(kali㉿kali)-[~]
└─$ python3
Python 3.12.7 (main, Nov  8 2024, 17:55:36) [GCC 14.2.0] on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> q=66347
>>> p=12611
>>> tn=(p-1)* (q-1)
>>> tn
836623060
>>> 

Operacion 5: sacar el hipertexto, tambien tenemos formula.

>>> e= 3
>>> n= 
>>> m=6357294171489311547190987615544575133581967886499484091352661406414044440475205342882841236357665973431462491355089413710392273380203038793241564304774271529108729717
>>> c = pow(m,e,n)
>>> c

Operacion 6:

Operacion 7:
q = 

p = 

e = 65537

tn = (p-1) * (q-1)

d = inverse(e,tn)


picoCTF{wA8_th4t$_ill3aGal..ode01e4bb}
```

picoCTF{wA8_th4t$_ill3aGal..ode01e4bb}

## Notas Adicionales 

*El cifrado RSA permite a los usuarios cifrar mensajes con un código llamado clave pública que pueden compartir abiertamente. Debido a las propiedades matemáticas del algoritmo RSA específico, una vez que un usuario cifra un mensaje con una clave pública, solo una clave privada puede descifrarlo. Los usuarios tienen un par de claves públicas y privadas y estas últimas se mantienen en secreto.*
## Referencias
